keyword: how many calories in a piece of cheesecake
title: How Many Calories in a Piece of Cheesecake?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a piece of cheesecake, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Piece of Cheesecake?
assumptions: Standard slice (1/8 of 9-inch New York-style cheesecake, ~100 g), baked with cream cheese, eggs, sugar, graham cracker crust; no toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, brand, and additions like fruit or whipped cream. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical piece of cheesecake contains about 350 kcal, with high fat and carbs from cream cheese and crust.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Low-fat version (reduced cream cheese and crust)
Add strawberry topping (1 tbsp fruit and sauce)

faqs.q: How many calories in a piece of cheesecake?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard 100 g slice.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in cheesecake?
faqs.a: About 25 g total fat per piece, including 15 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does cheesecake have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20 g sugars per slice from the filling and crust.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in cheesecake?
faqs.a: Opt for low-fat ingredients, skip the crust, or choose smaller portions.
Moderatelyâ€”about 6 g protein per piece, mainly from cream cheese and eggs.
